pull_request.title: test: adding an example for cluster on local pvc creation
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please take a look at our Contributing documentation before submitting a Pull Request!
https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/

Thank you for contributing to Rook! -->

**Description of your changes:**
adding an example for cluster on local pvc creation

**Which issue is resolved by this Pull Request:**
Resolves #

**Checklist:**

- [x] **Commit Message Formatting**: Commit titles and messages follow guidelines in the [developer guide](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/#commit-structure).
- [x] Reviewed the developer guide on [Submitting a Pull Request](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/#submitting-a-pull-request)
- [ ] [Pending release notes](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/PendingReleaseNotes.md) updated with breaking and/or notable changes for the next minor release.
- [ ] Documentation has been updated, if necessary.
- [ ] Unit tests have been added, if necessary.
- [ ] Integration tests have been added, if necessary.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,127 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+#set -eEx
+KUBECTL="minikube kubectl --"
+ROOK_EXAMPLES_DIR="../../deploy/examples/"
+
+wait_for_ceph_cluster() {
+    echo "Waiting for ceph cluster"
+    WAIT_CEPH_CLUSTER_RUNNING=20
+    while ! $KUBECTL get cephclusters.ceph.rook.io -n rook-ceph -o jsonpath='{.items[?(@.kind == "CephCluster")].status.ceph.health}' | grep -q "HEALTH_OK"; do
+	echo "Waiting for Ceph cluster installed"
+	sleep ${WAIT_CEPH_CLUSTER_RUNNING}
+    done
+    echo "Ceph cluster installed and running"
+}
+
+get_minikube_driver() {
+    os=$(uname)
+    architecture=$(uname -m)
+    if [[ "$os" == "Darwin" ]]; then
+        if [[ "$architecture" == "x86_64" ]]; then
+            echo "hyperkit"
+        elif [[ "$architecture" == "arm64" ]]; then
+            echo "qemu"
+        else
+            echo "Unknown Architecture on Apple OS"
+	    exit 1
+        fi
+    elif [[ "$os" == "Linux" ]]; then
+        echo "kvm2"
+    else
+        echo "Unknown/Unsupported OS"
+	exit 1
+    fi
+}
+
+show_ceph_dashboard_info() {
+    DASHBOARD_PASSWORD=$($KUBECTL -n rook-ceph get secret rook-ceph-dashboard-password -o jsonpath="{['data']['password']}" | base64 --decode && echo)
+    IP_ADDR=$($KUBECTL get po --selector="app=rook-ceph-mgr" -n rook-ceph --output jsonpath='{.items[*].status.hostIP}')
+    PORT="$($KUBECTL -n rook-ceph -o=jsonpath='{.spec.ports[?(@.name == "dashboard")].nodePort}' get services rook-ceph-mgr-dashboard-external-http)"
+    BASE_URL="http://$IP_ADDR:$PORT"
+    echo "==========================="
+    echo "Ceph Dashboard: "
+    echo "   IP_ADDRESS: $BASE_URL"
+    echo "   PASSWORD: $DASHBOARD_PASSWORD"
+    echo "==========================="
+}
+
+setup_minikube_env() {
+    minikube_driver="$(get_minikube_driver)"
+    echo "Setting up minikube env (using $minikube_driver driver)"
+    minikube delete
+    minikube start --disk-size=40g --extra-disks=1 --driver "$minikube_driver"
+    eval "$(minikube docker-env -p minikube)"
+}
+
+create_rook_cluster() {
+    echo "Creating cluster"
+    $KUBECTL apply -f crds.yaml -f common.yaml -f operator.yaml
+    $KUBECTL apply -f cluster-test.yaml -f toolbox.yaml
+    $KUBECTL apply -f dashboard-external-http.yaml
+}
+
+check_examples_dir() {
+    CRDS_FILE="crds.yaml"
+    if [ ! -e ${CRDS_FILE} ]; then
+	echo "File ${ROOK_EXAMPLES_DIR}/${CRDS_FILE} does not exist. Please, provide a valid rook examples directory."
+	exit 1
+    fi
+}
+
+wait_for_rook_operator() {
+    echo "Waiting for rook operator"
+    $KUBECTL rollout status deployment rook-ceph-operator -n rook-ceph --timeout=180s
+    while ! $KUBECTL get cephclusters.ceph.rook.io -n rook-ceph -o jsonpath='{.items[?(@.kind == "CephCluster")].status.phase}' | grep -q "Ready"; do
+	echo "Waiting for cluster to be ready..."
+	sleep 20
+    done
+}
+
+enable_rook_orchestrator() {
+    echo "Enabling rook orchestrator"
comment.body: @travisn I think once we fix all the issues we are working on we should be in a good spot to enable it by default.

pull_request.title: test: adding a script to simplify test cluster creation
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please take a look at our Contributing documentation before submitting a Pull Request!
https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/

Thank you for contributing to Rook! -->

**Description of your changes:**
Adding a script for devs to simplify the test cluster creation. By now it just create the one-node cluster without 
enabling any kind of service but more parameterized functionality can be added later for the different supported
modules (rgw, nfs, etc).

**Which issue is resolved by this Pull Request:**
Resolves #

**Checklist:**

- [x] **Commit Message Formatting**: Commit titles and messages follow guidelines in the [developer guide](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/#commit-structure).

- [ ] [Pending release notes](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/PendingReleaseNotes.md) updated with breaking and/or notable changes for the next minor release.
- [ ] Documentation has been updated, if necessary.
- [ ] Unit tests have been added, if necessary.
- [ ] Integration tests have been added, if necessary.

comment.body: Added logic to check if a minikube env already exists and a new option `-f` for force the cluster creation in such situations.

comment.body: And wanted to understand what does this mean https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/deploy/examples/import-external-cluster.sh#L29

pull_request.title: pool: rbd cmd shouldn't use admin in external mode
pull_request.body:
when creating networkFence, rbd command was loading admin config and hence running rbd command use client.admin in case of external cluster also. With this commit instead of client.admin user it will use what is being passed to config.

<!-- Please take a look at our Contributing documentation before submitting a Pull Request!

pull_request.title: pool: rbd cmd shouldn't use admin in external mode
pull_request.body:
when creating networkFence, rbd command was loading admin config and hence running rbd command use client.admin in case of external cluster also. With this commit instead of client.admin user it will use what is being passed to config.

comment.body: Added some docs on where to find the script. About where they can run the script I think it's self explanatory as the script by default will pick the example dir, otherwise the user has to provide the path and the script will check if the provided path is correct or not. I also added a usage/help function.

pull_request.title: pool: rbd cmd shouldn't use admin in external mode
pull_request.body:
when creating networkFence, rbd command was loading admin config and hence running rbd command use client.admin in case of external cluster also. With this commit instead of client.admin user it will use what is being passed to config.

issue.title: MDS pods started for external Ceph cluster
issue.body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
Hello,
I have external Ceph cluster. I deployed CephCluster resource , setting it to external using helm chart, but when I enabled CephFilesystem , two MDS pods were started in rook-ceph-external namespace and they connected to external Ceph cluster.
On external Ceph cluster itself I saw that filesystem and data+metadata pools were created, but storage class on Kubeternes was not able to work with it. Ceph cluster reported that stray daemon are connected to cluster.

```
root@ceph01:~/ssl# ceph health detail
HEALTH_WARN 2 stray daemon(s) not managed by cephadm; 2 stray host(s) with 2 daemon(s) not managed by cephadm
[WRN] CEPHADM_STRAY_DAEMON: 2 stray daemon(s) not managed by cephadm
    stray daemon mds.ceph-filesystem-a on host worker01 not managed by cephadm
    stray daemon mds.ceph-filesystem-b on host worker02 not managed by cephadm
[WRN] CEPHADM_STRAY_HOST: 2 stray host(s) with 2 daemon(s) not managed by cephadm
    stray host worker01 has 1 stray daemons: ['mds.ceph-filesystem-a']
    stray host worker02 has 1 stray daemons: ['mds.ceph-filesystem-b']
root@ceph01:~/ssl#
```

When I disabled CephFilesystem creation in helm chart and created ceph filesystem manually on Ceph storage, then created storageclass manually, I was able to create PVC and work with it.

Seems this problem is visible only when external Ceph cluster is deployed by cephadm. When deployed manually using binaries, pods are started, but it is possible to work with filesystem.

**Expected behavior:**

MDS pods are not started. I believe as this is external Ceph cluster, they should not run at all.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
- Deploy Ceph cluster using cephadm
- Install rook ceph operator and cephcluster using external mode using helm charts

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary

```
eksadmin@bastion:~$ kubectl --namespace rook-ceph-external get cephcluster
NAME                 DATADIRHOSTPATH   MONCOUNT   AGE   PHASE       MESSAGE                          HEALTH      EXTERNAL   FSID
rook-ceph-external   /var/lib/rook                26h   Connected   Cluster connected successfully   HEALTH_OK   true       cbd96647-70de-11ee-a34a-df5a876dc2c5
eksadmin@bastion:~$ kubectl --namespace rook-ceph-external get cephcluster -o yaml
apiVersion: v1
items:
- apiVersion: ceph.rook.io/v1
  kind: CephCluster
  metadata:
    annotations:
      meta.helm.sh/release-name: rook-ceph-cluster
      meta.helm.sh/release-namespace: rook-ceph-external
    creationTimestamp: "2023-10-23T09:26:35Z"
    finalizers:
    - cephcluster.ceph.rook.io
    generation: 6
    labels:
      app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
    name: rook-ceph-external
    namespace: rook-ceph-external
    resourceVersion: "899869"
    uid: 92da466b-6b35-4b42-89b2-34bd1e756728
  spec:
    cephVersion:
      image: quay.io/ceph/ceph:v17.2.6
    cleanupPolicy: {}
    crashCollector:
      disable: true
    dashboard: {}
    dataDirHostPath: /var/lib/rook
    disruptionManagement: {}
    external:
      enable: true
    healthCheck:
      daemonHealth:
        mon:
          interval: 45s
        osd: {}
        status: {}
      livenessProbe:
        mgr: {}
        mon: {}
        osd: {}
    logCollector: {}
    mgr: {}
    mon: {}
    monitoring:
      enabled: true
      externalMgrEndpoints:
      - ip: 192.168.100.121
      - ip: 192.168.100.122
      - ip: 192.168.100.123
    network:
      connections:
        compression: {}
        encryption: {}
      multiClusterService: {}
    priorityClassNames:
      mgr: system-cluster-critical
      mon: system-node-critical
      osd: system-node-critical
    resources:
      cleanup:
        limits:
          cpu: 500m
          memory: 1Gi
        requests:
          cpu: 500m
          memory: 100Mi
      crashcollector:

          cpu: 500m
          memory: 60Mi
        requests:
          cpu: 100m
          memory: 60Mi
      exporter:

          cpu: 250m
          memory: 128Mi
        requests:
          cpu: 50m
          memory: 50Mi
      logcollector:
        limits:
          cpu: 500m
          memory: 1Gi
        requests:
          cpu: 100m
          memory: 100Mi
      mgr:
        limits:
          cpu: "1"
          memory: 1Gi
        requests:
          cpu: 500m
          memory: 512Mi
      mgr-sidecar:
        limits:
          cpu: 500m
          memory: 100Mi
        requests:
          cpu: 100m
          memory: 40Mi
      mon:
        limits:
          cpu: "2"
          memory: 2Gi
        requests:
          cpu: "1"
          memory: 1Gi
      osd:
        limits:
          cpu: "2"
          memory: 4Gi
        requests:
          cpu: "1"
          memory: 4Gi
      prepareosd:
        requests:
          cpu: 500m
          memory: 50Mi
    security:
      keyRotation:
        enabled: false
      kms: {}
    storage:
      flappingRestartIntervalHours: 0
      store: {}
      useAllDevices: true
      useAllNodes: true
    waitTimeoutForHealthyOSDInMinutes: 10
  status:
    ceph:
      capacity:
        bytesAvailable: 769474162688
        bytesTotal: 769856110592
        bytesUsed: 381947904
        lastUpdated: "2023-10-24T11:28:14Z"
      fsid: cbd96647-70de-11ee-a34a-df5a876dc2c5
      health: HEALTH_OK
      lastChanged: "2023-10-23T13:53:57Z"
      lastChecked: "2023-10-24T11:28:14Z"
      previousHealth: HEALTH_ERR
      versions:
        mds:
          ceph version 17.2.6 (d7ff0d10654d2280e08f1ab989c7cdf3064446a5) quincy (stable): 2

          ceph version 17.2.6 (d7ff0d10654d2280e08f1ab989c7cdf3064446a5) quincy (stable): 2
        rgw:
          ceph version 17.2.6 (d7ff0d10654d2280e08f1ab989c7cdf3064446a5) quincy (stable): 3
    conditions:
    - lastHeartbeatTime: "2023-10-24T09:55:43Z"
      lastTransitionTime: "2023-10-24T09:55:43Z"

      reason: ClusterConnecting
      status: "True"

    - lastHeartbeatTime: "2023-10-24T11:28:14Z"

  resourceVersion: ""
```

**Logs to submit**:

* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

  To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
  When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
  Read [GitHub documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).

**Cluster Status to submit**:

* Output of kubectl commands, if necessary

  To get the health of the cluster, use `kubectl rook-ceph health`
  To get the status of the cluster, use `kubectl rook-ceph ceph status`
  For more details, see the [Rook kubectl Plugin](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest-release/Troubleshooting/kubectl-plugin)

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): 
`Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS`
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
`Linux bastion 5.15.0-87-generic #97-Ubuntu SMP Mon Oct 2 21:09:21 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: 
`Hyper-V virtual machines`
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
```
[rook@rook-ceph-operator-5c4c7f984d-mwpxs /]$ rook version
rook: v1.12.6
go: go1.21.3
[rook@rook-ceph-operator-5c4c7f984d-mwpxs /]$
```
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
`ceph version 17.2.6 (d7ff0d10654d2280e08f1ab989c7cdf3064446a5) quincy (stable)`
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
eksadmin@bastion:~$ kubectl version
Client Version: v1.28.3
Kustomize Version: v5.0.4-0.20230601165947-6ce0bf390ce3

```
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): EKS-Anywhere , running Ubuntu
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest-release/Troubleshooting/ceph-toolbox/#interactive-toolbox)):
```
root@ceph01:~# ceph health
HEALTH_OK
root@ceph01:~#
```

comment.body:
Hello @travisn
yes, this is true, if I uncomment `cephFileSystems: {}` cephfilesystem will not be created.  But then I have to do following:
- create filesystem on external Ceph server manually
- create storageclass for Ceph filesystem manually

Similarly it works when I set cephblockpool or cephobjectstore to {}

But, as cephblockpool or cephobjectstore can work with external cluster automatically , so for example cephblockpool can create block pool for itself on external cluster and then storageclass, I believe similar way should work also cephfilesystem.

So in short, yes, I can disable it with {} , but then I have to do things manually. I believe it should be able to work with both internal and external clusters. Just somehow tell it not to start MDS pods in external mode.

comment.body:
My problem is proxy server. 
Can I install the rook+ceph server from the mirror repo? I mirror the necessary repos and install them, can this be solved? This way, none of the components would use a proxy server.

issue.title: build: Add go modules for apis subdir
issue.body:
<!-- Please take a look at our Contributing documentation before submitting a Pull Request!
https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/

Thank you for contributing to Rook! -->

**Description of your changes:**
To keep the go dependencies minimal, add the go packages just for the pkg/apis directory. Projects that only reference the rook apis can then have a smaller footprint for Go dependencies.

This takes the number of dependencies down currently from 1963 lines down to 1101, which is another nice reduction. 
The dependencies still include the controller runtime due to the webhook implementation. If we remove the webhook in favor of CEL as described in #12938 perhaps we can remove that dependency as well.

This is a follow-up to again attempt to support the trimmed Go modules in the pkg/apis directory. This was first added in #12160 and later reverted in #12764 due to the lack of dependabot working with these separate go modules. 

Before this is merged, we still need to investigate how to integrate this with dependabot.

**Checklist:**

- [ ] **Commit Message Formatting**: Commit titles and messages follow guidelines in the [developer guide](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/#commit-structure).
- [ ] Reviewed the developer guide on [Submitting a Pull Request](https://rook.io/docs/rook/latest/Contributing/development-flow/#submitting-a-pull-request)
- [ ] [Pending release notes](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/PendingReleaseNotes.md) updated with breaking and/or notable changes for the next minor release.
- [ ] Documentation has been updated, if necessary.
- [ ] Unit tests have been added, if necessary.
- [ ] Integration tests have been added, if necessary.

comment.body:
@travisn I may have found the issue we had with dependabot, we were updating the version on directory `/` https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/0c5c8d76454d9f8434048c46d454966acccab499/.github/dependabot.yml#L5-L6  which means ```Configuring the key to / automatically instructs Dependabot to search the /.github/workflows directory, as well as the action.yml / action.yaml file from the root directory.``` it was not looking for directory `/pkg/apis`.

We can directory passing the directory `/pkg/apis` in depandabot.yaml configuration in a new section.

- [ ] Unit tests have been added, if necessary.

comment.body: Hi @travisn, this pull request was opened against a release branch, is it expected? Normally patches should go in the master branch first and then be backported to release branches.

repo.name: rook
repo.description: Open, Universal, Cloud Native, Distributed Storage

issue.title: MountDevice failed for volume pvc-f631... An operation with the given Volume ID already exists
issue.body:
<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
Kubernetes tries to attach the pvc to a pod and fails:
```
  Normal   SuccessfulAttachVolume  25m                  attachdetach-controller       AttachVolume.Attach succeeded for volume "pvc-f631ef53-35d6-438b-a496-d2ba77adb57d"
  Warning  FailedMount             23m                  kubelet, node3  MountVolume.MountDevice failed for volume "pvc-f631ef53-35d6-438b-a496-d2ba77adb57d" : rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded
  Warning  FailedMount             4m59s (x5 over 18m)  kubelet, node3  Unable to attach or mount volumes: unmounted volumes=[volume], unattached volumes=[volume default-token-4dbg8]: timed out waiting for the condition
  Warning  FailedMount             2m41s (x5 over 23m)  kubelet, node3  Unable to attach or mount volumes: unmounted volumes=[volume], unattached volumes=[default-token-4dbg8 volume]: timed out waiting for the condition
  Warning  FailedMount             32s (x18 over 23m)   kubelet, node3  MountVolume.MountDevice failed for volume "pvc-f631ef53-35d6-438b-a496-d2ba77adb57d" : rpc error: code = Aborted desc = an operation with the given Volume ID 0001-0009-rook-ceph-0000000000000001-3e7b0d61-5335-11ea-a0a0-3e8b30a597e0 already exists
```
On other nodes in the cluster, the attach and mount works fine and as expected. 
**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
Create an example cluster with a rbd-csi storage-class. Create a PVC and a pod, attaching the pvc.
I think the issue lies somewhere in mismatching configuration, software, kernel modules, etc.
<!--
* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

 To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
Read [Github documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).
-->
**Environment**:
__of the node trying to mount:__
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
```
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="16.04.6 LTS (Xenial Xerus)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS"
VERSION_ID="16.04"
HOME_URL="http://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="http://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
VERSION_CODENAME=xenial
UBUNTU_CODENAME=xenial
```
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
`Linux lb-173 4.15.0-88-generic #88~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Feb 12 04:19:15 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
Baremetal
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
```
rook: v1.1.2-44.g2c195d7
go: go1.11
```
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
`ceph version 14.2.6 (f0aa067ac7a02ee46ea48aa26c6e298b5ea272e9) nautilus (stable)`
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"17", GitVersion:"v1.17.2", GitCommit:"59603c6e503c87169aea6106f57b9f242f64df89", GitTreeState:"archive", BuildDate:"2020-01-25T21:52:51Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"17", GitVersion:"v1.17.0", GitCommit:"70132b0f130acc0bed193d9ba59dd186f0e634cf", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-12-07T21:12:17Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
Baremetal cluster with kubeadm
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): `HEALTH_OK`

comment.body: 这是来自QQ邮箱的假期自动回复邮件。邮件已收到，我会尽快回复您!
